page.title: 05Caving around Ingleton
page.content: The Ingleton, Horton-in_Ribbesdale and Settle areas must see hundreds of people in both summer and winter. Compared with other sports and pass- times very few people die whilst caving. Actual fatalities can only by measured over long period of years.There are 170 people in the cave rescue team.The Yorkshire Dales have some of the best and wettest potholes in the British Isles and are too numerous to count. Mr Bond first joined the rescue team 17 years ago in Burnley.The rescue team has two land Rovers with emergency trailers.These contain first aid equipment,ropes, stretchers,ladders,climbing equipment and marker flares.Some of the equipment lets the patient help them- selves.Serious incidents have occured in the past.Some times these incidents are not as serious as they seem.
